## What's Being Collected

Based on the JavaScript features being used, Apple.com is primarily collecting information about **how you navigate and interact with the website**. The site is also monitoring your browser's location information (what website you're currently on) and examining the structure of the page itself.

The data being collected helps Apple understand user behavior (which products people are interested in, navigation patterns) to improve the website experience and inform marketing decisions. However, this information could potentially be combined with other data (like your Apple ID if you're logged in, or cookies tracking you across the web) to build a detailed profile of your interests and browsing habits. For a privacy-conscious user, this is worth knowing about, though it's not unusual or inherently malicious—it's how most large commercial websites operate today.
